oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shiloh Burial Association Pamphlet

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Jackson, William Hicks, 1835-1903; Pamphlets
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pamphlet from the Shiloh Burial Association announcing the formation of a group soliciting donations to purchase 200 acres of the ground at Shiloh for the purpose of building memorials and planting an Osage orange hedge.; The pamphlet features a list of individuals who have already donated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Shiloh Burial Association
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William H. Jackson was born in 1835 and served in the Confederate army from 1861-1865 in Missouri, Tennessee, Alabama, Georgia, and Mississippi.; He became active in agriculture after the war and was eventually appointed Commissioner of Agriculture. He died 1903. The Osage orange hedge mentioned in the pamphlet was planted in 1871.
